verses.text: 屬靈的恩賜弟兄們，關於屬靈的恩賜，我不願意你們不明白。

words.note: Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'
Often refers to divine or spiritual gifts in Christian contexts.
Commonly used in the Bible for fellow believers.
Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'
Often refers to divine or spiritual gifts in Christian contexts.
Lit. 'clear white', meaning 'understand clearly'.

verses.text: 你們知道，你們還是教外人的時候，總是受迷惑被引誘，去拜那不能說話的偶像。

words.note: Lit. 'people outside the teaching/religion'.
Often implies being deceived or led astray.

verses.text: 所以我要你們知道，被 神的靈感動而說話的人，沒有一個會說「耶穌是可咒詛的」；除非是被聖靈感動，也沒有人能說「耶穌是主」。

words.note: The small space and font often denote reverence in Christian texts.
Refers to being under a curse or detestable.
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.
Refers to Jesus as the Lord.

verses.text: 恩賜有許多種，卻是同一位聖靈所賜的；

words.note: Often refers to divine or spiritual gifts in Christian contexts.
Indicates a turn or contrast.
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.
Used with a verb to form a nominalized phrase, indicating the agent.

verses.text: 服事的職分有許多種，但是同一位主；

words.note: Refers to a specific role or ministry.
Refers to Jesus as the Lord.

verses.text: 工作的方式也有許多種，但仍是一位 神，是他在眾人裡面作成一切。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God, often capitalized.
Often implies divine accomplishment in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 聖靈顯現在各人的身上，為的是要使人得著益處。

words.note: Refers to the third person of the Trinity.

words.definition: for the purpose of, in order to
to want, to be going to, to make

words.note: Common in biblical texts, emphasizes successful attainment.

verses.text: 有人藉著聖靈領受了智慧的言語，又有人靠著同一位聖靈領受了知識的言語，

words.note: Often used for divine or significant words in religious contexts.

verses.text: 又有人因著同一位聖靈領受了信心，還有人因著這位聖靈領受了醫病的恩賜，

words.note: Refers to gifts given by God, often spiritual.

verses.text: 另有人可以行神蹟，另有人可以講道，另有人可以辨別諸靈，也有人能說各種的方言，也有人能翻譯方言。

words.note: 諸 is a classical plural marker, here meaning 'all spirits' or 'various spirits'.
In biblical context, refers to speaking in spiritual tongues (glossolalia).

verses.text: 這一切都是這同一位聖靈所作的，他按照自己的意思個別地分給各人。

words.note: Polite measure word for persons, often used in religious contexts.
Indicates the agent or recipient of an action, often in passive-like structures.

verses.text: 正如身體是一個，卻有許多肢體，而且肢體雖然很多，身體仍是一個；基督也是這樣。

words.note: Often refers to members of a spiritual body in the Bible.
Often refers to members of a spiritual body in the Bible.

verses.text: 我們無論是猶太人，是希臘人，是作奴隸的，是自由的，都在那一位聖靈裡受了洗，成為一個身體，都飲了那一位聖靈。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun-like entity ('those who are slaves').
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun-like entity ('those who are free').
Polite measure word for persons, often used in religious contexts.
受洗 (shòuxǐ) is the verb 'to be baptized'.
Polite measure word for persons, often used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 原來身體有許多肢體，並不是只有一個肢體。

words.note: Often refers to members of a spiritual body in the Bible.

words.definition: is not at all, certainly not
words.note: Emphatic negation, 'certainly not'.
Often refers to members of a spiritual body in the Bible.

verses.text: 假如腳說：「我不是手，所以我不屬於身體。」它不能因此就不屬於身體。

words.note: Indicates a consequence or result.

verses.text: 假如耳朵說：「我不是眼睛，所以我不屬於身體。」它也不能因此就不屬於身體。

breakdown.m: by means of, so as to

verses.text: 假如整個身體只是眼睛，怎樣聽呢？假如整個身體只是耳朵，怎樣聞味呢？

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to smell (a scent)'.

verses.text: 但現在 神按照自己的意思，把肢體一一放在身體上。

words.note: The space before 神 is a convention in some Chinese Bibles to show reverence.
Introduces the object before the verb.
In biblical context, refers to body parts or members of a community/church.
Used as a directional complement or postposition.

verses.text: 假如所有的只是一個肢體，怎能算是身體呢？

words.note: Turns a preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'all of them'.
In biblical context, refers to body parts or members of a community/church.

verses.text: 但現在肢體雖然很多，身體卻只是一個。

words.note: In biblical context, refers to body parts or members of a community/church.

verses.text: 眼睛不能對手說：「我不需要你。」頭也不能對腳說：「我不需要你們。」
相反地，身體上那些似乎比較軟弱的肢體，更是不可缺少的。

words.note: Refers to body parts, often used metaphorically for members of a group or church body in scripture.
Lit. 'cannot be lacked'

verses.text: 我們認為身體上不大體面的部分，就更加要把它裝飾得體面；不大美觀的部分，就更加要使它美觀。

words.note: Used with '不' to mean 'not very' or 'not too'.
Refers to dignity, honor, or outward appearance.
Indicates result or degree after a verb.
Refers to dignity, honor, or outward appearance.
Used with '不' to mean 'not very' or 'not too'.

verses.text: 我們身體上美觀的部分，就不需要這樣了。但 神卻這樣把身體組成了：格外地把體面加給比較有缺欠的肢體，

words.note: The preceding space is a stylistic mark of reverence for God in some Chinese Bibles.
Refers to dignity, honor, or outward appearance.
Refers to body parts, often used metaphorically for members of a group or church body in scripture.

verses.text: 好使肢體能夠互相照顧，免得身體上有了分裂。

words.definition: so that, in order to make

words.note: Refers to body parts, often used metaphorically for members of a group or church body in scripture.

verses.text: 如果一個肢體受苦，所有的肢體就一同受苦；如果一個肢體得榮耀，所有的肢體就一同快樂。

words.note: Used metaphorically for members of Christ's body.
Used metaphorically for members of Christ's body.
Used metaphorically for members of Christ's body.
Used metaphorically for members of Christ's body.

verses.text: 你們就是基督的身體，並且每一個人都是作肢體的。

words.note: Used metaphorically for members of Christ's body.

verses.text: 神在教會裡所設立的，第一是使徒，第二是先知，第三是教師，其次是行神蹟的，再其次是有醫病恩賜的，幫助人的，治理事的，說各種方言的。

words.note: Refers to miraculous speaking in unknown languages.

verses.text: 難道都是使徒嗎？都是先知嗎？都是教師嗎？都是行神蹟的嗎？

words.note: Used to introduce rhetorical questions.

verses.text: 都是有醫病恩賜的嗎？都是說方言的嗎？都是翻譯方言的嗎？

words.note: Refers to miraculous speaking in unknown languages.
Refers to miraculous speaking in unknown languages.

verses.text: 你們卻要熱切地追求那些更大的恩賜。現在我要把更高的道路指示你們。

words.note: Describes the manner of action.
Specifically refers to spiritual gifts in a biblical context.
Used to prepose the object of a verb for emphasis.
Can refer to 'the Way' or a spiritual path.
